S31640-020_syn_1:
Indication: BI obstruction (tumor).
Proc: Rigid bronch, mechanical debulking.
Findings: 80% obstruction Bronchus Intermedius.
Action: Rigid coring, forceps excision.
No thermal/balloon.
Result: 60% patency.
EBL: 15mL.
S31640-020_syn_2:
PROCEDURE: Rigid bronchoscopic recanalization of the bronchus intermedius.
INDICATION: Symptomatic malignant airway obstruction.
TECHNIQUE: Mechanical debulking was performed. The rigid scope was advanced to core the polypoid mass. Forceps were utilized for piecemeal excision of the tumor fragments. No thermal energy or balloon dilation was applied. 
OUTCOME: Improvement in lumen patency to approximately 60%.
S31640-020_syn_3:
Code: 31640.
Service: Excision of tumor.
Location: Bronchus Intermedius.
Tools: Rigid scope (coring), Forceps.
Rationale: Documentation supports physical removal of tissue to relieve obstruction. No thermal ablation was used.

S31640-020_syn_9:
Procedure: Rigid endoscopy with physical resection of BI mass.
Findings: Polypoid growth obstructing the intermediate airway.
Intervention: The rigid instrument was used to shear the growth. Grasping tools were employed for extraction. No thermal devices were utilized.
Result: Partial restoration of airway caliber.

Patient: [REDACTED], 57-year-old female
MRN: [REDACTED]
Date: [REDACTED]
Location: [REDACTED]
Attending: Dr. Colin Hayes

Indication:
Obstruction of bronchus intermedius (BI) from endobronchial tumor with chronic cough and dyspnea.

Procedure:
Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of BI tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia:
General anesthesia; rigid bronchoscope; ASA class III.

Findings:
Polypoid mass in the bronchus intermedius with ~80% obstruction.

Interventions:
Rigid coring and forceps debulking were used to mechanically debulk and excise the tumor. Tumor removed in piecemeal fashion until the lumen was ~60% patent. No thermal ablation or balloon used.

Hemostasis:
Mild; controlled with cold saline.

EBL:
15 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Extubated and discharged to floor for overnight observation.
